channel.title: [PI] command
channel.description:
if (playerCommand.equals("pkpts")) { c.sendMessage("You have killed "+c.pkPoints people in OptimusScape!); }
I'm getting errors... can anyone help? Heres the errors
src\server\model\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1719: error: unclosed string liter al sendFrame126("@gre@Teleports, 16036); ^ src\server\model\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1719: error: ';' expected sendFrame126("@gre@Teleports, 16036); ^ src\server\model\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1720: error: ')' expected sendFrame126("", 16036); ^ src\server\model\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1720: error: not a statement sendFrame126("", 16036); ^ src\server\model\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1720: error: not a statement sendFrame126("", 16036); ^ src\server\model\players\PlayerAssistant.java:1720: error: ';' expected sendFrame126("", 16036); ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:413: error: ')' expected c.sendMessage("You have killed "+c.pkPoints peop le in OptimusScape!); ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:413: error: ';' expected c.sendMessage("You have killed "+c.pkPoints peop le in OptimusScape!); ^ 8 errors Press any key to continue . . .

item.title: [PI] command
item.dc:creator: @Jacob5 Jacob_
item.description:
@Jacob5 wrote:

Every opening String literal has to have a closing Sting literal. And if you wish to add an integer or some other data into the String you would close the first String literal add a plus symbol, add the variable, another plus symbol then add another String for the rest of the text.

String a = "a";
String b = "The first letter of the alphabet is " + a + "!";

final int letters = 26;
String s =  "There are " + letters + " letters in the alphabet.";

Read full topic

item.description:
@Skiire wrote:

Read the errors.

“Unclosed string literal”

c.sendMessage(“You have killed " + c.pkPoints + " people in OptimusScape!”);

I don’t know what you were trying to do before.
